org.hps.detector.ecal

Class HPSEcalDetectorElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.detector.DetectorElement
      • org.lcsim.detector.converter.compact.SubdetectorDetectorElement
        • org.hps.detector.ecal.HPSEcalDetectorElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HPSEcalAPI, Identifiable, IDetectorElement

    public final class HPSEcalDetectorElement
extends SubdetectorDetectorElement
implements HPSEcalAPI
    This is an implementation of a basic geometry API for the HPS ECAL.

    The neighboring API and conventions are based on the page 7 diagram from the ECAL Manual Annex in which the viewpoint is from the beam towards the detector.

    See Also:
    HPSEcalAPI, EcalCrystal, IDetectorElement, SubdetectorDetectorElement

      • computeIndexRanges

        void computeIndexRanges()

      • createNeighborMap

        private void createNeighborMap()
        Create a map of a crystal to its adjacent neighbors in all eight cardinal directions. Non-existent crystals are filtered out if the the geometry object does not exist, which automatically takes care of edge crystals and missing crystals from the beam gap without explicitly needing to check those indices for validity.

      • getNeighborIndices

        private static int[] getNeighborIndices(EcalCrystal crystal,
                                        HPSEcalDetectorElement.NeighborDirection direction)
        Get the neighbor indices of a crystal.
        Parameters:
        crystal - The ECAL crystal geometry object.
        direction - The direction of the neighbor from integer encoding.
        Returns:
        The neighbor indices.
